page.title: 19Village Life
page.content: The{houses} here in New Herrington are mainly terraced or modernised council houses which are made of brick and have been pebble-dashed. There is a very friendly corner shop here. It is run by Mr Turnbull and his wife and has really low prices and a wide variety of groceries, tins and biscuits. It also sells loo rolls, soap and those sorts of things. During the miners strike the other corner shop in this area closed down. Futher up the road there is a Post Office. The{Post Office}is very handy when you are short of a stamp or some wrapping paper for a present. It also gives you your{Giro}when you need it. Herrington has very few amenities for children, no clubs and very few pubs. There is only the bowling green and the football pitch.
